DOC.brief_title: Autoregulation Glomerular Filtration Rate Patients With Type 1 Diabetes During Spironolactone Therapy
DOC.detailed_description: Double-masked , randomize , crossover trial . In random order , patient treat spironolactone 25 mg o.d . match placebo 28 day . On last day treatment , GFR determine twice day : first without clonidine secondly injection clonidine ( clonidine induces transient reduction blood pressure , influence renal plasma flow GFR ) , order evaluate effect antihypertensive treatment spironolactone renal autoregulation GFR . The study precede wash-out period 1 month patient receive antihypertensive medication . Patients instructed measure blood pressure twice daily , three day week period . If , washout period , blood pressure exceed 170/105 mm Hg persistent edema develop , treatment long-acting loop diuretic initiate continue throughout rest study . If blood pressure despite diuretic treatment still exceed 170 mm Hg systolic and/or 105 mm Hg diastolic , patient exclude study previous/appropriate antihypertensive treatment restart .
DOC.criteria: Type 1 diabetes Age 18 70 year Blood pressure ≥ 135 mm Hg systolic and/or ≥ 85 mm Hg diastolic ongoing antihypertensive treatment Informed consent Diabetic nephropathy Other know kidney renal tract disease Malignant hypertension Blood pressure > 170/105 baseline AHT washout period Plasma potassium > 4.7 mmol/l Elevated plasma creatinine ( > 88 µmol/l woman > 100 µmol/l men ) Symptoms Ischemic heart disease within 3 month prior study start Previous cerebrovascular event ( apoplexy , TCI ) Abuse medicine alcohol Pregnancy breastfeed Woman childbearing age use adequate contraception ASA treatment > 1g/day regular use NSAIDs Known allergy sideeffects spironolactone Inability understand patient information
